tips: Follow your plan from Section 4 - don't change structure midway
Use topic sentences to start each body paragraph
Include linking words (However, Furthermore, For instance)
Avoid contractions (don't → do not, can't → cannot)

sections.title: Band 8 Model Answer
sections.description: Compare your essay with this high-band example

essay.fullEssay:
The practice of taking a year off between secondary school and higher education has become increasingly common among young people worldwide. While this break offers significant benefits in terms of personal development, it also presents certain challenges that students should carefully consider.

On the positive side, gap years provide valuable real-world experience that enhances maturity and academic readiness. Students who work, travel, or volunteer during this period develop independence, life skills, and broader cultural perspectives that prove invaluable in university environments. For instance, those who travel abroad often return with improved language abilities, greater confidence, and enhanced problem-solving skills. Furthermore, this time allows young people to clarify their career goals before committing to expensive degree programs, potentially reducing the likelihood of changing majors or dropping out. Research consistently demonstrates that gap year students often achieve higher grades and show greater motivation than their peers who proceed directly to university.

However, extended breaks from formal education carry notable disadvantages. Students may lose academic momentum, finding it challenging to readjust to classroom environments and study routines after a year away from structured learning. Additionally, gap years can be financially burdensome, particularly if they involve international travel or unpaid volunteering, potentially creating debt before university even begins. Some students also face peer pressure or feel they are falling behind their contemporaries. More seriously, a proportion of gap year students never actually return to education, either because they become comfortable in employment or lose their academic motivation entirely.

In conclusion, while gap years offer maturity and life experience that benefit university performance, they risk academic disruption and financial strain. The decision ultimately depends on whether students have structured, purposeful plans rather than simply delaying their education.

strengths: Balanced discussion of both advantages and disadvantages
Clear organization with strong topic sentences
Wide range of vocabulary (readiness, invaluable, contemporaries)
Complex sentence structures with varied grammar
